rules.natural: Either the food sample is contaminated, or the event poses a public health risk.
In the event that the food sample has microbial growth, it has pathogen present.
Assuming the food sample has pathogen present, then if the food sample is contaminated, it causes illness.
The food sample has visual contamination or it has odor contamination.
Whenever the food sample has odor contamination, it is not compliant.
If the food sample has a critical violation, then it has a severe violation.
Given that the food sample has improper storage, then if it is contaminated, it causes illness.
Either the food sample has improper storage, or it has a temperature violation.
In the case that the food sample has a temperature violation, it has a time violation.
Should the food sample have a time violation, then it has microbial growth.
If an event is inspection scheduled, then it poses a public health risk.
Whenever an event is inspection completed, it is inspection scheduled.
Provided that it is not true that visual contamination leads to non-compliance, then the food sample has a critical violation.
In the event that it is false that a time violation implies contamination causes illness, then the food sample has a minor violation.
If an event is not inspection completed, then the food sample is compliant.
Whenever an event is not inspection completed, the event requires follow-up.
Should an event not be inspection completed, then it is not the case that the event requires follow-up.

facts.natural: It is not true that the food sample has a severe violation.
The food sample does not cause illness.
It is not the case that the food sample has a minor violation.

target.natural: An event poses a public health risk.

(A1 → A2).natural: If the food sample is contaminated, then it causes illness.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either the food sample is contaminated, or the event poses a public health risk.

(A10 → (A1 → A2)).natural: Provided that the food sample has microbial growth, then whenever the food sample is contaminated, it causes illness.

(A10 → A11).natural: In the event that the food sample has microbial growth, it has pathogen present.

(A11 → (A1 → A2)).natural: Assuming the food sample has pathogen present, then if the food sample is contaminated, it causes illness.

(A13 → ¬A12).natural: Should the food sample have visual contamination, then it is not compliant.

(A13 ∨ A14).natural: The food sample has visual contamination or it has odor contamination.

(A14 → ¬A12).natural: Whenever the food sample has odor contamination, it is not compliant.

(A16 → A15).natural: If the food sample has a critical violation, then it has a severe violation.

(A3 → (A1 → A2)).natural: Given that the food sample has improper storage, then if it is contaminated, it causes illness.

(A3 ∨ A4).natural: Either the food sample has improper storage, or it has a temperature violation.

(A4 → (A1 → A2)).natural: Provided that the food sample has a temperature violation, then whenever it is contaminated, it causes illness.

(A4 → A5).natural: In the case that the food sample has a temperature violation, it has a time violation.

(A5 → (A1 → A2)).natural: Assuming the food sample has a time violation, then if it is contaminated, it causes illness.

(A5 → A10).natural: Should the food sample have a time violation, then it has microbial growth.

(A7 → G).natural: If an event is inspection scheduled, then it poses a public health risk.

(A8 → A7).natural: Whenever an event is inspection completed, it is inspection scheduled.

(¬(A13 → ¬A12) → A15).natural: If it is not the case that visual contamination implies non-compliance, then the food sample has a severe violation.

(¬(A13 → ¬A12) → A16).natural: Provided that it is not true that visual contamination leads to non-compliance, then the food sample has a critical violation.

(¬(A5 → (A1 → A2)) → A6).natural: In the event that it is false that a time violation implies contamination causes illness, then the food sample has a minor violation.

(¬A8 → A12).natural: If an event is not inspection completed, then the food sample is compliant.

(¬A8 → A9).natural: Whenever an event is not inspection completed, the event requires follow-up.

(¬A8 → ¬A9).natural: Should an event not be inspection completed, then it is not the case that the event requires follow-up.

G.natural: An event poses a public health risk.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that the food sample is contaminated.
